circuits.description: The Alapaha Judicial Circuit is located in southern Georgia and encompasses five counties: Atkinson, Berrien, Clinch, Cook, and Lanier. This circuit primarily covers rural areas known for their agricultural landscapes and small-town charm.

additionalOffices.address: 303 S. Hammond Dr., Suite 98, Monroe, GA 30655

circuits.description: The Alcovy Judicial Circuit serves Newton and Walton Counties in the north-central Piedmont region of Georgia, providing public defense services to communities east of metropolitan Atlanta.
The Appalachian Judicial Circuit covers three mountainous counties in north Georgia: Fannin, Gilmer, and Pickens. The circuit is known for its scenic beauty and outdoor recreation.

circuits.address: 100 Peachtree Street, NW, Suite 1600, Atlanta, GA 30303
circuits.description: The Atlanta Judicial Circuit is located in north-central Georgia and encompasses Fulton County. This circuit covers a highly urbanized area, including the city of Atlanta, the state's capital and largest city.

circuits.address: 201 South Main Street, Suite 2400, Hinesville, GA 31313

additionalOffices.address: 108 W. Brazell St, Suite 321, Reidsville, GA 30453

circuits.description: The Atlantic Judicial Circuit serves six coastal and near-coastal counties in southeastern Georgia, including the area surrounding Fort Stewart military installation.
The Augusta Judicial Circuit encompasses two counties in the Central Savannah River Area, including Georgia's second-largest city, Augusta.
The Brunswick Judicial Circuit covers five counties along Georgia's southeastern coast, including the historic port city of Brunswick and the Golden Isles.
The Chattahoochee Judicial Circuit serves six counties in west-central Georgia, including Columbus, the state's third-largest city.
The Cherokee Judicial Circuit covers Bartow and Gordon Counties in northwest Georgia, an area with a rich history in the Cherokee Nation.
The Clayton Judicial Circuit serves Clayton County, located south of Atlanta and home to Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport.
The Conasauga Judicial Circuit serves Murray and Whitfield Counties in northwest Georgia, known as the 'Carpet Capital of the World.'

circuits.address: 7045 Evans Town Center Boulevard, 3rd Floor, Evans, GA 30209
circuits.description: The Columbia Judicial Circuit serves Columbia County in east Georgia.
The Cordele Judicial Circuit covers four counties in south-central Georgia, an agricultural region known for its watermelon production.
The Coweta Judicial Circuit serves three counties in west Georgia, including the cities of Newnan and LaGrange.
The Dekalb Judicial Circuit serves DeKalb County, one of Georgia's most populous and diverse counties, located east of Atlanta.
The Dougherty Judicial Circuit serves Dougherty County in southwest Georgia, home to the city of Albany, a regional hub for commerce and healthcare.
The Dublin Judicial Circuit covers four counties in central Georgia, centered around the city of Dublin.

circuits.address: 222 W Oglethorpe Ave, Suite 130, Savannah, GA 31401
circuits.description: The Eastern Judicial Circuit serves Chatham County, home to the historic city of Savannah and Georgia's busiest seaport.

circuits.address: 194 Courthouse Hill, Annex B, Dahlonega, GA 30533

additionalOffices.address: 59 South Main Street, Suite C, Cleveland, GA 30528

circuits.description: The Enotah Judicial Circuit covers four mountain counties in northeast Georgia, including popular tourist destinations in the Blue Ridge Mountains.
The Flint Judicial Circuit serves Henry County, a rapidly growing suburban community south of Atlanta.

additionalOffices.address: 141 West Solomon Street, Suite 4099, Griffin, GA 30224

circuits.description: The Griffin Judicial Circuit covers four counties in west-central Georgia, including the city of Griffin, known for its textile history.
The Lookout Mountain Judicial Circuit covers four counties in Georgia's northwest corner, including areas near Lookout Mountain and Chickamauga Battlefield.
The Macon Judicial Circuit serves three counties in central Georgia, including Macon, a major hub of commerce, transportation, and higher education.

circuits.address: 360 Bulldog Rd. Ste. A, Lyons, GA 30436
circuits.description: The Middle Georgia Judicial Circuit covers five counties in east-central Georgia, a primarily rural agricultural region.
The Mountain Judicial Circuit serves three counties in northeast Georgia's Blue Ridge Mountains, a popular destination for tourism and outdoor recreation.
The Northeastern Judicial Circuit covers two counties in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains in northeast Georgia.

circuits.address: 461 Cook St. Ste J, Royston, GA 30662
circuits.description: The Northern Judicial Circuit serves five counties in northeast Georgia along the South Carolina border.

additionalOffices.address: 113 N. Main St, Suite 123, Greensboro, GA 30642
12630 Broad Street, Suite J, Sparta, GA 31087

circuits.description: The Ocmulgee Judicial Circuit covers eight counties in central Georgia, including Milledgeville, the state's former capital.
The Oconee Judicial Circuit serves six rural counties in central Georgia, an agricultural region known for its forestry and farming.
The Ogeechee Judicial Circuit covers four counties in east Georgia, including Statesboro, home to Georgia Southern University.
The Pataula Judicial Circuit serves seven rural counties in southwest Georgia along the Alabama and Florida borders.
The Paulding Judicial Circuit encompasses Paulding County, one of the fastest-growing counties in metropolitan Atlanta's western suburbs.

additionalOffices.address: 652 Barrow Park Dr., Suite C, Winder, GA 30680

circuits.description: The Piedmont Judicial Circuit serves three counties in northeast Georgia, a mix of rural communities and growing suburbs.
The Rockdale Judicial Circuit encompasses Rockdale County, a suburban community east of Atlanta with a diverse population.

circuits.address: 12 East Fourth Avenue, Suite 10, Rome, GA 30161
circuits.description: The Rome Judicial Circuit serves Floyd County in northwest Georgia, home to the city of Rome, situated at the confluence of three rivers.
The South Georgia Judicial Circuit covers five counties in the southwest corner of Georgia, a region known for hunting plantations and agriculture.

circuits.address: 106 S Patterson St, Suite 201, Valdosta, GA 31601

additionalOffices.address: 9 South Main St, Ste 105, Moultrie, GA 31768

circuits.description: The Southern Judicial Circuit serves five counties in south Georgia, including Valdosta, home to Valdosta State University.

circuits.address: 510 West Lamar Street, 2nd Floor, Americus, GA 31709
circuits.description: The Southwestern Judicial Circuit covers six counties in southwest Georgia, including Americus, home to Georgia Southwestern State University.
The Tallapoosa Judicial Circuit covers Haralson and Polk Counties in west Georgia near the Alabama border.
The Tifton Judicial Circuit serves four counties in south-central Georgia, with Tifton serving as a regional agricultural research center.
The Toombs Judicial Circuit serves six counties in east-central Georgia, a region with rich colonial and Civil War history.

circuits.address: 135 L. Cary Bittick Drive, Forsyth, GA 31029
circuits.description: The Towaliga Judicial Circuit covers three counties in central Georgia between Atlanta and Macon along Interstate 75.

circuits.address: 605 Church Street, Suite D, Waycross, GA 31501
circuits.description: The Waycross Judicial Circuit serves six counties in southeast Georgia, including areas adjacent to the Okefenokee Swamp.

circuits.description: The West Georgia Judicial Circuit serves Carroll and Heard Counties in west Georgia, a growing region west of metropolitan Atlanta.
The Western Judicial Circuit serves Clarke and Oconee Counties, home to the University of Georgia in Athens.

optOutCircuits.note: Cherokee County operates its own public defender office independently.
